main_text:
What the Genotype-Phenotype Distinction Signifies
6. What the Genotype-Phenotype Distinction Signifies

That special experimental conditions are entailed in the original
formulation of the terms genotype, phenotype, and the distinction
between them also has implications for the issues that might seem to
have been settled by the adoption of Johannsen’s
genotype-concept of heredity.
hierarchy_title: The Genotype/Phenotype Distinction || What the Genotype-Phenotype Distinction Signifies
